definition: To affix one's signature to a document or written agreement, typically indicating consent, agreement, or endorsement. This action is commonly performed when finalizing contracts, legal documents, or official paperwork.

examples.english: I have to sign the contract.

examples.german: Er hat den Brief ohne zu unterschreiben zur체ckgeschickt.
examples.english: He returned the letter without signing it.

examples.german: Sie hat den Vertrag unterschrieben, ohne ihn zu lesen.
examples.english: She signed the contract without reading it.

examples.german: Der K체nstler unterschreibt seine Gem채lde immer auf der R체ckseite.
examples.english: The artist always signs his paintings on the back.
